content.question: <math alttext="R b C l" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>RbCl</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> has a high boiling point. Which of the following compounds is also likely to have a high boiling point, and why?

choices.label: <math alttext="N O" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>NO</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>, because its elements are in the same period of the periodic table.
<math alttext="C l F" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>ClF</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>, because its elements are in the same group of the periodic table.

<math alttext="C l 2 O" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>Cl</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mtext>O</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>, because its elements have similar electronegativities and it is a covalent compound.
<math alttext="C s C l" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mtext>CsCl</mtext></mrow></math>, because its elements have very different electronegativities and it is an ionic compound.

content.answer: <math alttext="C s C l" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mtext>CsCl</mtext></mrow></math>, because its elements have very different electronegativities and it is an ionic compound.

skill.text: 4.C: Explain the connection between particulate-level and macroscopic properties of a substance using models and representations.
